text:
I've received a number of complaints from customers at my hosting company that 
ZIP and PDF files are failing to open correctly in IE. I've traced this 
problem to mod_deflate - it appears that the latest version of IE fails to 
open gzipped ZIP and PDF content. I'm not sure if this problem is with IE or 
mod_deflate, but either way adding the following line to my httpd.conf 
resolved the problem:
SetEnvIfNoCase Request_URI \.(?:gif|jpe?g|png|zip|pdf)$ no-gzip dont-vary

This is perhaps worth investigation, if only to note the bug in IE in 
mod_deflate's documentation and suggesting a workaround as above.
creator: kieran@digital-crocus.com
ranier@cultura.com.br
text:
It seems that the problem is Internet Explorer:
Look at:
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=85BB441A-5BB1-4A82-86EC-A249AF287513&displaylang=en

snip:
"
Update for Internet Explorer 6 SP1 - Internet Explorer Does Not Correctly
Decompress Data with GZIP Data Compression Method (837251)

When you use Microsoft Internet Explorer to download or to open data that is
compressed with the GZIP compression method, you may receive an error message.
"

Bug is invalid?

Ranier Vilela
